item.title: 65 Blackstock Road Abandoned vehicle opposite primary school, homeless people inside, and drug paraphernalia, 8th June
item.description:
Abandoned vehicle on the drive has been broken into multiple times, reported to police. Homeless people now occupy it, using drugs and dumping items like boilers and mattresses. It's outside a primary school, day care, and near homes with children.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blackstock Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned suspicious vehicle, 8th June
item.description:

item.title: Front garden always full of rubbish spilling onto street, 8th June
item.description:
The house continually has rubbish piled up in the garden and overflowing bins. The mess is also extending onto the street. Huge piles of clothes, mattress, rotting food, old trampoline. It smells and is dangerous and unsightly. This an ongoing problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned van, 8th June
item.description:
This van has been here for about two years now, it's in disrepair and has not been moved off the sidewalk taking space from other vehicles needing to park nearby.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravenscroft Road, Penge, London

item.title: Loads of rubbish, 8th June

item.title: Strewn rubbish on footpath, 8th June
item.description:
This happens every week outside 20 Bromley Grove. Why don't you use my council tax to supply this property with adequate waste bins? You have a duty of care to keep public footpaths safe to use. There are unhygienic bags of used nappies among the debris creating a health hazard. I am an above knee amputee and have to walk in the middle of the road to avoid this weekly hazard and unsightly mess. How many times does this same problem have to be reported to you before you deal with it satisfactorily? It cannot be economically viable to send a 2 man team with spades and a truck as happened a couple of weeks ago when the mess recurs within days. Give them some bins. It's an absolute disgrace and failure on your part.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Bromley Grove, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 8th June
item.description:
Rubbish dumped . This needs to be removed before the foxes create a mess . Please not the Bromley borough refuse sacks . If this is not removed I will demand a discount on my council tax .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, High Street, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
